raw_comment:
I notice that young men are less likely to reach out to their parents than women do through sending texts, phone or video-chat, or visiting them in person. I wonder if it has to do something with pride with men, or just possible jobs that keep them more busy. This relates to me and my community because I try to reach out to my parents through one or more of the 3 reasons listed on the graph.
A possible catchy headline would be, "Being In Contact: How Often Do Young People Reach Out To Their Parents?"
ace_sentences: Young men are less likely to reach out to their parents than young women are.
Young men reach out to their parents by sending texts.
Young men reach out to their parents by phone.
Young men reach out to their parents by video-chat.
Young men reach out to their parents by visiting their parents in person.
I wonder whether pride causes this behavior in men.
I wonder whether jobs keep young men more busy.
This topic relates to my community.
I try to reach out to my parents.
I reach out to my parents by at least 1 of the 3 reasons that are listed on the graph.
A possible headline is: Being In Contact: How Often Do Young People Reach Out To Their Parents?
